CatDescriptText: Mrs. Hazel Harrison, 1005 Rivermont Drive, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 21, 1957, pg. 3 with question: "Do you think that the proposed six-day-a-week school attendance, as proposed by Governor Leader, is the answer to the Russian challenge in scientific education?" answer reads: "Really and truly, I for one mother would be bitterly against it. I prefer a one and one-half hour addition to the school day or the continuation of the school term into July rather than a straight six day week.  As it is, a lot of students make use of the two day weekend, and they need Saturdays for themselves."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Hazel Harrison, wearing light colored head scarf, coat with wide lapels, and light colored gloves, standing in front of large block wall with windows on either side, one with Christmas tree
